markdown:
<title level="1" right="Spell 5" pfs="Standard">
[Summon Fiend](/Spells.aspx?ID=1701)
<actions string="Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Summon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=520" />
<trait label="Unholy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=521" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 361 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Tradition**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You summon a creature that has the [fiend](/Traits.aspx?ID=70) trait and whose level is 5 or lower to fight for you. The GM might determine your deity restricts the specific types of fiends you can summon in certain cases. For instance, [archdevils](/DeityCategories.aspx?ID=4) typically allow their followers to summon [devils](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=30), but not other fiends.

---
**Heightened (6th)** Level 7.

**Heightened (7th)** Level 9.

**Heightened (8th)** Level 11.

**Heightened (9th)** Level 13.

**Heightened (10th)** Level 15.
name: Summon Fiend
